title: Introduction to implication
course: Discrete Mathematics by Prof Sudarshan Iyengar

transcript.text: Here is something that you all should  concentrate. The most important part of
the chapter at the same time very confusing  as well, the implication, P implies Q. What
does it even mean? When you have a statement P  and a statement Q when you say P implies Q what
exactly does this mean? You may want to unlearn  what you already know about implication because
we are going to fine-tune the meaning that you  know already and give it a brand new meaning.
